description:
Job Title: Electronics Manufacturing Process Specialist

As an Electronics Manufacturing Process Specialist, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our electronics manufacturing processes. This includes developing process improvements, monitoring and tracking data, and collaborating with engineering teams to ensure that all equipment on the circulator line is running and operational.

Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement process improvements to optimize SMT and Subarray area operations.
• Monitor and track data for various SMT processes to identify areas for improvement.
• Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure that all equipment on the circulator line is running and operational.
• Develop and update work instructions and process documentation.
• Assist engineering in the development of new processes and selection of equipment.
• Interface and resolve manufacturing issues with Electronic Manufacturing Specialists.

Requirements:
• High school graduate or equivalent.
• Minimum of six (6) college credits in a laboratory science such as chemistry or physics, computer science, or a related technical field.
• Experience in a Manufacturing and/or laboratory environment or equivalent preferred.

What We Offer:

We are committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

U.S. Citizenship is required for all positions with a government clearance and certain other restricted positions.
